title: Where does the Bible describe Jesus’ appearance? - Quora

response.answer_text: No one really knows what Jesus looked like that’s the mystery of God right there. The only clue is this scripture. Revelation 1:14-15 Jesus's skin was a darker hue and that his hair was woolly in texture. The hairs of his head, it says, "were white as white wool, white as snow. His eyes were like a flame of fire, his feet were like burnished bronze, refined as in a furnace.” What you see in movies & TV shows is their vision of Jesus & how he looked. That’s phony & fake & isn’t backed up by scripture. Nothing but hearsay, rumor’s & gossip so take it with a grain of salt.

The Bible does not describe the historical Jesus’ appearance. There are a couple passages in Revelation describing the appearance of Jesus, but those descriptions are heavily symbolic and reflect what the author saw in a mystical vision sixty years after the crucifixion, and not what the historical Jesus actually looked like. Otherwise, the passage in Revelation is often misrepresented: it says nothing about the texture of his hair (only the color), and burnished bronze is a golden metallic color, not brown or black. The same passage says that he had a sword sticking out of his mouth and seven stars in his hand, and the same book also describes him in the form of a slain sheep.
